paper_abstract: Given a set of s points and a set of n(2) lines in three-dimensional Euclidean space such that each line is incident to n points but no n lines are coplanar, we show that s = Omega(n(11/4)). This is the first non-trivial answer to a question recently posed by Jean Bourgain.
paper_title: On a question of Bourgain about geometric incidences
